meta.title: Content and Section Blueprint
meta.summary: Author revised copy and information architecture for each section with visual and interaction intent.

result.summary: Defined concrete section/content blueprint for the DM dashboard landing page and validated domain copy, starter-copy removal, lint, and typecheck.

commands.command: rg -n "DM Internal Systems|Unified operations dashboard|Platform Availability|Daily Ingest Volume|Order Throughput Trend|Incident Queue|Recent Activity Feed" apps/web/app/page.tsx
! rg -n "To get started, edit the page.tsx file|Deploy Now|Documentation" apps/web/app/page.tsx

task.objective: Define and verify the landing page content blueprint, including final section copy and information architecture for the DM internal systems dashboard.
constraints: Blueprint must map directly to implemented section hierarchy in apps/web/app/page.tsx.
All content must remain operationally plausible for internal systems and avoid placeholder Next.js starter copy.
Validation must be deterministic and scriptable with repository tooling.

allowed_files.note: Landing route copy and section structure source.

steps.instruction: Establish top-level content architecture: page header, KPI row, trend+queue split, placeholder row, and activity feed table.
steps.artifact: Route includes at least five distinct section bands with dashboard-specific purpose.

steps.instruction: Verify section copy reflects realistic internal operations language and intent (ingest, catalog, purchasing, risk, incidents).
steps.artifact: Headline and section labels are domain-specific and no starter copy remains.

steps.instruction: Run lint/typecheck to confirm blueprint-aligned content compiles and passes quality gates.
steps.artifact: Lint and typecheck pass for the dashboard route.

commands: rg -n "DM Internal Systems|Unified operations dashboard|Platform Availability|Daily Ingest Volume|Order Throughput Trend|Incident Queue|Recent Activity Feed" apps/web/app/page.tsx

expected_output: Landing page content blueprint is concrete, sectioned, and represented in source with domain-specific copy.
The route demonstrates dashboard information architecture with at least five section types.
Validation commands pass and are recorded in lifecycle task result metadata.
stop_conditions: Stop and ask operator when required section content is missing from source or when quality gates fail due unrelated repository issues.
notes: Blueprint targets an operations-first dashboard tone suitable for DM internal systems.
Content hierarchy intentionally balances quick-glance KPIs with actionable table detail.
